result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher E Pfeifer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Concurrent with: Case 14CF856, if revoked.
The Conditions of Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.

Court will allow for transfer to Washington, Fond du Lac or any other County.
Court will allow for early termination of probation after 2 years as long as all requirements and restitution have been paid and Agent deems appropriate.
Concurrent with: Case 14CF856.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution ($11,690.20) to be paid to Jimmy Johns as a Condition of Probation BEFORE costs/fines.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with Jimmy Johns or witnesses listed in the criminal complaint.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Defendant is to contact DOC by 09:00 a.m. on 12-08-2014.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours with Standard Release Conditions - STAYED.
To be used at Agent's discretion.
Court will allow transfer to Washington, Fond du Lac or any other County.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Chapter 7 Bankruptcy Case - filed 5/12/16

Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Christopher E Pfeifer in court with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.  
Case called along with:  14CF856

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison: 4 Years
Initial Confinement:  2 Years
Extended Supervision:  2 Years
Concurrent with:  14CF856
Stayed

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation:  3  Years
Concurrent with:  14CF856
Court will allow for transfer to Washington, Fond Du Lac or  any other County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Court will allow for early termination of probation after 2 years as long as all requirements and restitution have been paid and agent deems appropriate.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim (Jimmy Johns) or witnesses listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Defendant to contact D.O.C. by 9:00 a.m. on Monday 12/08/14

Restitution:  $11,690.20 (to be paid to Jimmy Johns - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and SURCHARGE:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  
Court will allow for transfer to Washington, Fond Du Lac or  any other County.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
